instruction: What kinds of spectrum was used in the classification of ginseng cultivation age?
Output: The spectrum used in the classification of ginseng cultivation age was high-resolution magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance (HR-MAS NMR) spectroscopy.

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used in the classification of ginseng cultivation age?
Output: NMR spectroscopy with deep learning and partial least-squares discriminant analysis (PLS-DA) were used in the classification of ginseng cultivation age.

instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the accuracy of the classification models in the classification of ginseng cultivation age?
Output: The metric chosen to evaluate the accuracy of the classification models in the related study was the percentage accuracy. The accuracy of the partial least-squares discriminant analysis (PLS-DA) model was reported as 87.1%, while the accuracy of the deep learning model was reported as 93.9%.

instruction: What machine learning models were used in the classification of ginseng cultivation age using deep learning?
Output: The machine learning models used in the classification of ginseng cultivation age using deep learning were deep learning and partial least-squares discriminant analysis (PLS-DA).

instruction: Can the combination of NMR spectroscopy and deep learning be considered a superior method for discriminating the cultivation age of ginseng compared to traditional methods?
Output: Yes, the combination of NMR spectroscopy and deep learning can be considered a superior method for discriminating the cultivation age of ginseng compared to traditional methods. The text states that the accuracy of the deep learning model was 93.9%, which is higher than the accuracy of the traditional method using partial least-squares discriminant analysis (87.1%). This suggests that the deep learning model, when combined with NMR spectroscopy, provides a more accurate and reliable means of determining the cultivation age of ginseng.
